qa_pairs.question: Are the dependent atelectatic changes unilateral or bilateral?
Which mediastinal and hilar regions were specifically assessed for lymph nodes?
qa_pairs.answer: Prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, and bilateral hilar-axillary regions.

qa_pairs.question: Which part of the vertebrae is mentioned with respect to height?
From which region do the stomach and abdominal structures herniate, and into which cavity do they extend?
qa_pairs.answer: From the hiatal region into the thorax.

qa_pairs.question: Which mediastinal and hilar regions were specifically referenced in the lymph node assessment?
qa_pairs.answer: Prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, and bilateral hilar-axillary regions.

qa_pairs.question: Which major airways are mentioned by name in the report?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea and both main bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: Which segment of the esophagus is specified in the evaluation?
Were any obstructive findings noted within the tracheobronchial lumen?
qa_pairs.answer: No, no obstructive pathology was detected in the lumen.

qa_pairs.question: Are the parenchymal nodules in the lungs unilateral or bilateral?
Is the linear atelectasis confined to one lung or present in both?
Are the nonspecific density increases described as dependent, and do they involve one or both lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: They are dependent and involve both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Were enlarged lymph nodes detected in the prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, or bilateral hilar-axillary regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No enlarged lymph nodes were detected in those regions.

qa_pairs.question: Were mass lesions with distinguishable borders identified in either lung?
qa_pairs.answer: No, none were detected in either lung.

qa_pairs.question: Were pathologically enlarged lymph nodes observed in the axilla or supraclavicular fossa?
qa_pairs.answer: No; none were observed in the axilla or supraclavicular fossa

qa_pairs.question: Were pathologically enlarged lymph nodes present in the mediastinum?
qa_pairs.answer: No; none were observed in the mediastinum

qa_pairs.question: At what airway level are bronchial wall thickness increases observed?
Were any suspicious masses or nodular space-occupying lesions detected within the lung parenchyma?
Were lytic-destructive lesions identified in the bones?
qa_pairs.answer: No; none were detected in bone structures

qa_pairs.question: Was pericardial effusion detected within the pericardial space?
Which organ was not visualized due to prior surgery?
Where were pneumonic infiltrative involvement or consolidation areas not detected?
Are emphysematous changes unilateral or bilateral, and where are they located?
Are millimetric nodules confined to one lung or present in both?
Which artery had its diameter measured at 28 mm?
In which vessels are atheromatous/atherosclerotic changes located?
qa_pairs.answer: The aorta and the coronary arteries.

qa_pairs.question: Is the bronchiectasis described as centrally or peripherally distributed?
qa_pairs.answer: Centrally distributed in both lungs, with more prominent involvement in the right middle lobe medial segment.

qa_pairs.question: Are the pulmonary ground-glass density increases unilateral or bilateral?
Are the consolidative areas unilateral or bilateral?
qa_pairs.answer: Bilateral, in the lower lobes of both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: How many hypodense lesions are identified in the posterior right hepatic lobe?
In which anatomic region are millimetric lymph nodes observed?
Are the emphysematous changes unilateral or bilateral?
Do the millimetric parenchymal nodules involve one lung or both?
Where are the fibroatelectasis (sequelae) changes located?
In the upper abdominal sections within the study area, which organs and on which sides had hypodense lesions?
Which airways are described as open without occlusion?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea and the lumens of both main bronchi

qa_pairs.question: In which vessel wall were calcified changes observed?
What anatomical site shows a hernia in this exam?
Which regions were specifically noted regarding pathologic lymph nodes?
Which central airway structures are described as open?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea and both main bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: In which part of the airways was occlusive pathology specifically not detected?
qa_pairs.answer: In the lumens of the trachea and both main bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: Which thoracic region could not be optimally evaluated on this non-contrast exam?
In which specified mediastinal and hilar regions were enlarged lymph nodes not detected?
qa_pairs.answer: Prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, and bilateral hilar-axillary regions.

qa_pairs.question: Within the imaged portion of the liver, were any space-occupying lesions present?
qa_pairs.answer: No, none were detected in the portion of the liver that entered the cross-sectional area.

qa_pairs.question: Which mediastinal hollow organ’s calibration was specifically mentioned?
Are the reported areas of increased density confined to one lung or present in both lungs?
Which additional anatomic region beyond the thorax is stated to be included within the imaged sections?
Which central airway structures are explicitly mentioned in the report?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea and both main bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: Which regions are cited in relation to lymph node assessment?
qa_pairs.answer: The mediastinum and both axillary regions.

qa_pairs.question: Which lung regions are mostly involved by the ground-glass densities?
Is the distribution of the ground-glass densities localized or diffuse?
Which airway structures are reported as open?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea and both main bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: In what compartment are the small lymph nodes noted?
Along which axis were the mediastinal lymph nodes measured?
Were enlarged lymph nodes detected in the prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, or bilateral hilar-axillary regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No enlarged lymph nodes in those regions.

qa_pairs.question: Were the upper abdominal organs fully included within the scan coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: No, they were only partially included.

qa_pairs.question: Are the ground-glass densities more anterior or posterior?
qa_pairs.answer: Mostly posterior, in the posterobasal parts.

qa_pairs.question: In which anatomic compartment are the millimetric lymph nodes reported?
Do the mediastinal lymph nodes have a short-axis diameter greater than 1 cm?
qa_pairs.answer: No, their short axis does not exceed 1 cm.

qa_pairs.question: Are enlarged lymph nodes present in the prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, or bilateral hilar-axillary regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No, no enlarged lymph nodes are detected in those regions.

qa_pairs.question: Are the reticular density increases limited to one lung or present in both lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: They are present in both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Was any space-occupying lesion seen in the portion of the liver included in the scan?
qa_pairs.answer: No, none was seen in the imaged portion of the liver.

qa_pairs.question: In which vascular structures are calcific atheromatous plaques observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the aorta and coronary arteries.

qa_pairs.question: Do the bands and bronchiectasis extend toward the pleural surface or toward the mediastinum?
Where were air densities observed?
In which lungs were scattered fibroatelectatic sequelae changes and peribronchovascular axial interstitial and interlobular septal thickenings observed?
Which central airways are reported as open?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea and both main bronchi are open.

qa_pairs.question: Was any significant tumoral wall thickening detected in the thoracic esophagus?
qa_pairs.answer: No significant tumoral wall thickening was detected in the thoracic esophagus.
